model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Speaker B, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: How did you decide to become a therapist?
Speaker B: I've always loved the thought of helping people, and I love to listen and talk to people, so for me it always seemed like a perfect job!
Speaker A: That sounds really great. Do you enjoy it still? I think it would be really hard to listen to people and say the right thing.
Speaker B: Yeah I still love it, it can sometimes be challenging but when you see the impact you can make on some peoples' life it is soo rewarding! Have you ever done therapy?  
Speaker A: No, but I probably should. My husband suggested it because I have some "unresolved childhood trauma' or whatever. I find therapy in riding my horses... but it would probably be good to talk to someone.
Speaker B: Well, I have recently just had a client leave after successfully completing his journey so if you wanted I would be very happy to see you?
Speaker A: Oh wow you can complete therapy? I thought it was just something you did forever! That's good to know.
Speaker B: People can get to a point where they don't need me at all, for some it can be as quick as 4 or 5 sessions but some people feel they need to stay in therapy for years and years, it completely depends on the patient! 
Speaker A: Wow, that gives me a completely different perspective. You'd really be ok with seeing me? You don't think it would be a conflict of interest since we're friends?
Speaker B: No not at all but if you didn't feel comfortable talking to me I can recommend a couple of my colleagues who are just as brilliant
Speaker A: I'd prefer to see you since I'm already comfortable talking to you! It will get the awkward part out of the way for me!

[MEMORY]
Speaker B enjoys being around horses while working at a stable, which is why they are considering the psychological aspects of owning a horse, relating it to Freudian theories. Speaker B has been working in their own therapy practice for about six years, experiencing the ups and downs of the profession. This led to Speaker B becoming a professional in a practice where it is illegal for them to have relationships with clients.

Speaker B has been working in their own therapy practice for about six years, experiencing the ups and downs of the profession. speaker: Speaker B
raw_prediction: That's great to hear! I'm glad you feel comfortable with me. We can definitely work on addressing those unresolved childhood traumas together.
prediction:
Brief explanation: The memory mentions that Speaker B cannot have relationships with clients in their own practice due to professional ethics, which is relevant in this context because Speaker A has expressed interest in having Speaker B as their therapist. Even though they are friends, Speaker B suggests seeing Speaker A as a patient. Understanding this piece of information from the memory can help Speaker B navigate the conversation in a more professional manner.
Judgement: Yes
